selector.title: Server Selector
selector.desc: This is a list of all servers you can change settings on because you have the [Manage Server]($1) permission. Please select a server:
selector.none: You currently don't have the [Manage Server]($1) permission on any servers, are you logged into the correct account?
selector.invite: Wiki-Bot is not a member of $1 yet, but you can [invite Wiki-Bot]($2).

valid.title: The wiki is valid and can be used!
valid.MediaWiki: Warning: Requires at least $1 for full functionality.
valid.TextExtracts: Warning: Requires the extension $1 for page descriptions.
valid.PageImages: Warning: Requires the extension $1 for page thumbnails.

invalid.title: Invalid wiki!
invalid.text: The URL couldn't be resolved to a valid MediaWiki site!

outdated.title: Outdated MediaWiki version!
outdated.text: The recent changes webhook requires at least MediaWiki 1.30!

sysmessage.title: System message doesn't match!
sysmessage.text: The page $1 needs to match the server id $2.

prefix.space: The prefix may not include spaces!
prefix.code: The prefix may not include code markdown!
prefix.backslash: The prefix may not include backslashes!

unauthorized.title: Not logged in!
unauthorized.text: Please login before you can change any settings.

save.title: Settings saved!
save.text: The settings have been updated successfully.

nosettings.title: Server not set up yet!
nosettings.text: Please define settings for the server first.

logout.title: Successfully logged out!
logout.text: You have been successfully logged out. To change any settings you need to login again.

refresh.title: Refresh successful!
refresh.text: Your server list has been successfully refeshed.

missingperm.title: Missing permission!
missingperm.text: Either you or Wiki-Bot are missing the $1 permission for this function.

loginfail.title: Login failed!
loginfail.text: An error occurred while logging you in, please try again.

sysmessage.title: System message doesn't match!
sysmessage.text: The page $1 needs to match the server id $2.

mwversion.title: Outdated MediaWiki version!
mwversion.text: Requires at least MediaWiki 1.30, found $1 on $2.

nochange.title: Save failed!
nochange.text: The settings matched the current default settings.

invalidusergroup.title: Invalid user group!
invalidusergroup.text: The user group name was too long or you provided too many.

wikiblocked.title: Wiki is blocked!
wikiblocked.text: $1 has been blocked from being added as a recent changes webhook.

savefail.title: Save failed!
savefail.text: The settings could not be saved, please try again.

movefail.title: Settings partially saved!
movefail.text: The settings have only been partially updated.
movefail.note: The webhook channel could not be changed!

refreshfail.title: Refresh failed!
refreshfail.text: You server list could not be refreshed, please try again.

error.title: Unknown error!
error.text: An unknown error occured, please try again.

readonly.title: Read-only database!
readonly.text: You can currently only view your settings, but not change them.

form.confirm: Do you really want to delete the channel overwrite?
Do you really want to delete the verification?

verification.explanation:
User Verification

Using the !wiki verify <wiki username> command, users are able to verify themselves as a specific wiki user by using the Discord field on their wiki profile. If the user matches and user verifications are set up on the server, Wiki-Bot will give them the roles for all verification entries they matched.

Every verification entry allows for multiple restrictions on when a user should match the verification:

  • Channel to use the !wiki verify command in.
  • Role to get when matching the verification entry.
  • Required edit count on the wiki to match the verification entry.
  • Required user group to be a member of on the wiki to match the verification entry.
  • Required account age in days to match the verification entry.
  • Whether the Discord users nickname should be set to their wiki username when they match the verification entry.

rcscript.desc: These are the recent changes webhooks for $1:

form.display_compact: Compact text messages with inline links.
form.display_embed: Embed messages with edit tags and category changes.
form.display_diff: Embed messages with image previews and edit differences.
form.confirm: Do you really want to delete the recent changes webhook?

rcscript.explanation:
Recent Changes Webhook

Wiki-Bot is able to run a recent changes webhook based on RcGcDw. The recent changes can be displayed in compact text messages with inline links or embed messages with edit tags and category changes.

Requirements to add a recent changes webhook:

  • The wiki needs to run on MediaWiki 1.30 or higher.
  • The system message MediaWiki:Custom-RcGcDw needs to be set to the Discord server id .
